Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

drawing¶

Vector graphics reads geometry from .dxf and .svg files :requires: * dxfgrabber for dxf input * dxfwrite for dxf output * PIL or pillow for bitmap output

drawing.Trans(scale=1, offset=None, rotation=None)[source]¶
Returns::class:Matrix3 of generalized scale+offset+rotation

class drawing.Drawing(filename, options=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: drawing.Group

list of Entits representing a vector graphics drawing

__init__(filename, options=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
read_svg(filename, options=None, **kwargs)[source]¶
read_dxf(filename, options=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

reads a .dxf file :param filename: string path to .dxf file to read :param options: passed to :class:`~dxfgrabber.drawing.Drawing`constructor

img(size=[256, 256], border=5, box=None, layers=None, ignore=[], forcelayercolor=False, antialias=1, background='white')[source]¶
Parameters:
  • size – [x,y] max size of image in pixels. if one coord is None, the other one will be enforced
  • border – int border width in pixels
  • box – class:BBox bounding box. if None, box is calculated to contain all drawn entities
  • layers – list or dictionary of layers to draw. None = all layers
  • ignore – list of strings of entity types to ignore
Result:

PIL:Image rasterized image
drawing.img2base64(img, fmt='PNG')[source]¶
Parameters:img – PIL:Image
Result:string base64 encoded image content in specified format
See:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14348442/django-how-do-i-display-a-pil-image-object-in-a-template
